intro: Galeopsis ladanum, commonly known as hedge hyssop, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue or violet and are arranged in whorls along the stem. Galeopsis ladanum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
